title: Augsburg 2-2 Bayern Munich: Last-gasp equaliser holds Bayern as Lewandowski equals Aubameyang record
text:
Augsburg's Alfred Finnbogason scored a stoppage-time goal to snatch a 2-2 draw against a wasteful Bayern Munich on Saturday and deny them the top spot in the Bundesliga.

The hosts shocked Bayern with a goal after 28 seconds with Marco Richter volleying in from a Rani Khedira header.

Bayern forward Robert Lewandowski brought them level in the 14th minute, heading in a perfect Serge Gnabry cross for his 12th league goal of the season and his 16th in all competitions - after just 12 games.

Augsburg's Alfred Finnbogason scored in stoppage time to hold Bayern Munich 2-2

Serge Gnabry starred again, scoring and assisting, but Bayern lost the chance to go top

Robert Lewandowski scored his 16th goal in all competitions this season, having played 12

The Pole has now scored in each of Bayern's eight league games - equalling the record set by Arsenal star Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang while he was playing for Borussia Dortmund four years ago.

Gnabry, who also hit the post late in the first half, curled a superb left-footed low shot past Augsburg keeper Tomas Koubek in the 49th to give Bayern the lead.

Koubek repeatedly denied Kingsley Coman and Lewandowski before Finnbogason snatched the late equaliser.

Lewandowski equalled Pierre Emerick-Aubameyang by scoring in all eight opening games

Bayern were wasteful with chances in the game, and Lewandowski could have added more

Bayern remain in third place on 15 points, with leaders Borussia Moenchengladbach, on 16 after losing to Borussia Dortmund.
description: Augsburg's Alfred Finnbogason scored a stoppage-time goal to snatch a 2-2 draw against a wasteful Bayern Munich on Saturday and deny them the top spot in the Bundesliga.
